quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fruit and Ice
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, oz, fruits. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This cocktails ingredients are as follows: 1 1/4 oz. Southern Comfort, grapefruit juice, pineapple juice, soda. They are all mixed and shaken with ice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Southern Sparkler

questions.question: You just need 1 oz white creme de cacao and 1 oz white creme de menthe for this cocktail. They are poured over ice in an old fashioned glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peppermint Pattie

questions.question: This strongly acidic and detoxifying fruit grows on trees named Citrus sinensis and Citrus aurantium.
These fruits of the Family Musaceae are a valuable source of Vitamin A, Vitamin C, and potassium and are highly recommended by doctors to patients, whose potassium levels are low.
Botanically speaking, which of the following is not a fruit?
Who built the first restaurant from the McDonalds chain, one of the worlds largest chains of fast-food restaurants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The MacDonald brothers

questions.question: To prepare this one, you need 1 1/2 oz. Kahlua, 1/2 oz. peppermint schnapps, splash of cream and splash of cola. Shake the ingredients and add ice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colorado Minty Dog

questions.question: A potato will sometimes have green skin. What is characteristic of this skin?

options.text: It identifies a foreign (non USA) potato.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It contains a poisonous alkaloid.

questions.question: Which of the following groups of fruits are considered low-acid fruits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Similarly to spinach, this fruit, called petia in Spain, contains plenty of iron.
This is a type of punch. In a big bowl pour the following ingredients: 1 bottle red wine, shotglass of lime juice, 2 shots Bacardi and add random fruit. Chill the mixture overnight.
What was the first self service grocery store?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piggly Wiggly

questions.question: This more complex cocktail requires 1 1/2 oz light rum, 1 tbsp triple sec, 1 1/2 oz lime juice, 1 tsp sugar, 1 cherry and 1 cup crushed ice. Except the cherry, combine all ingredients and blend them for 5 seconds in a blender. Pour the mixture into a champagne glass and top with the cherry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frozen Daiquiri

questions.question: Why do doctors and dietitians recommend that we have five to nine fresh pieces of fruit a day?

options.text: Fruits help the organism release toxins.
Fruits are rich in vital vitamins.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What type of food is Pancetta?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Glass and Ingredients
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, oz, whiskey. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In a shaker, mix 1 oz Kahlua, 1 oz butterscotch schnapps and 6 oz milk. Strain into a glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kahlua Butterball

questions.question: Prepare 1 1/2 oz gin, 2 tsp grapefruit juice, 1 tbsp maraschino liqueur.  Mix all ingredients and shake them with ice. Then strain into a cocktail glass. Add a sprig of mint.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seventh Heaven

questions.question: Is it true that the word corn may refer to any cereal that is grown in a country?
In the trick-taking game of Hearts, what have you done, if you have just shot the sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taken every trick

questions.question: Take 50ml Rye Whiskey, 25ml Sweet Vermouth, 1 dash Angostura Bitters. Stir all the ingredients together with ice and strain in a martini glass. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.
For this refreshing cocktail you need 2 oz tequila, juice of 1/2 lime and Coca-Cola.  Mix tequila and lime  juice over ice cubes in a the glass. Add cola, stir, and its ready.

Prepare 1 1/2  oz lemon-flavored vodka, 3/4  oz fresh lemon juice, 1 lemon wedge, 1  teaspoon sugar. Moisten a martini glass with the lemon wedge and then dip it into sugar. Shake the ingredients well and strain into the sugared glass.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lemon Drop Cocktail

questions.question: This cocktail is a sweet combination of 4 oz. vodka, 2 oz. Midori and some Sprite mixed with ice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midori Dream

questions.question: The fish taco is generally cooked by what method?
Sometimes sushi is served rolled in nori. What is nori?
Layer ingredients in a shot glass in the following order: 15 ml Creme De Cacao white liqueur, 15 ml  Blue curacao liqueur, 15 ml Scotch Whisky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: African Violet

questions.question: Shake the following ingredients with ice: 1/2 oz. Creme De Banane, 1/2 oz. pineapple juice, 1 oz. gin, 1 oz. cream and add a dash of Grenadine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Velvet Kiss

questions.question: Stilton is a cheese which originated in which country?
This cocktail is as simple as mixing 1  oz vanilla liqueur and 1/2  fluid ounce cream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Beer

questions.question: To experience this sweet delight you need 1 oz light rum, 1 oz dark rum, 1 oz coconut cream, 1 cup Ice, 4 oz pineapple juice and 4 strawberries. Mix all the ingredients in a shaker.  Garnish with a pineapple wedge.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strawberry Colada

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Game and Card
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, making, sets. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Taking all thirteen tricks in a game of bridge is referred to as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grand slam

questions.question: This highly aromatic perennial herb, native to southern Europe, is widely used in salads, meat and potato balls, and its flavor is similar to that of anise.
In a game of Pinochle, what is the second highest ranking card?
Assuming there are no wildcards, which of the following hands would win a four-handed game of poker?

options.text: Ten of hearts, queen of diamonds, ten of clubs, queen of clubs, queen of spades
Five of clubs, five of diamonds, jack of hearts, jack of clubs, jack of spades
Ace of diamonds, five of hearts, four of clubs, three of hearts, two of spades
Six of diamonds, five of spades, four of hearts, three of spades, two of clubs

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ten of hearts, queen of diamonds, ten of clubs, queen of clubs, queen of spades

questions.question: In the card game Texas hold em, the last community card to hit the table is referred to as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The river

questions.question: Which card game, invented by British poet Sir John Suckling, is scored with a peg board?
Which popular substance, derived from orchids, is widely used in  the making of desserts.
This flowering plant, native to the eastern Mediterranean region and southwest Asia, is used as a spice in different liqueurs like raki and ouzo.
In order to double down in a game of blackjack, your two cards must total exactly what number?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Any number

questions.question: You have just laid down your entire hand in matched sets of four card books by taking cards from another player. What game have you just won?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Go Fish

questions.question: High, low, jack, and game are the four possible points in what trick-taking game?
Beleaguered castle is a form of what kind of card game?
Mace is one of the spices, derived from the fruit of this evergreen tree, indigenous to tropical southeast Asia and Australasia.
Oregano is a spicy perennial herb, particularly common to which region in Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mediterranean Region

questions.question: This herb, regarded as the king of herbs in many cooking books, is also known as Albahaca and St. Josephs Wort.

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Dish and Onion
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, sesame, wormwood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A Grasshopper is characterized by its soft color and taste, which comes from this strong green liqueur.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Creme de Menthe

questions.question: The legal drinking age in a few US states is 18.
Sesame is an annual plant , whose closest relatives originated in which continent?
There are several renditions of the famed Long Island Iced Tea, but almost all of the recipes call for this carbonated drink.
The seeds of which of these herbs are the key spice in Indian curries?
Which of these dishes is a traditional Mexican dish, prepared out of a tortilla dipped in a sauce, containing peppers?
This dish is usually cooked in a large, flat pan. It is most typical for the region of Valencia, Spain and contains ingredients such as rice, saffron and olive oil.
This is a traditional Scottish dish, boiled in a sheep’s stomach. Some of the main ingredients are sheep’s pluck, onion, salt and spices.

One and a half ounce of 80 proof liquor, straight or with a mixer, 12 ounce beer (a regular size can, bottle, mug, or glass) or a 5 ounce glass of wine all take about 8 hours each for your body to get rid of them.
This Hungarian dish, meaning cowherd, is prepared with beef, onion, red peppers and paprika.
Greyhound is a cocktail which contains Tonic.
This aromatic perennial herb, that is native to Europe, North Africa and Asia, is widely used in many cuisines, especially in the Mediterranean.
Brandy Separators are made with this coffee-flavored liqueur.
Which special type of wormwood, used exclusively for spicing, is one of the four fines herbes of French cooking?
This London style porter has the flavor of chocolate and coffee incorporated into the brewing process for a unique tasting adventure.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Chocolate and World
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the best environment for a cocoa tree to grow well?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these is not a Swiss chocolate manufacturer?
This Romanian dish, widely known around the world under the Italian name of polenta, is traditionally prepared of maize, cooked in an iron pot.
Which of these statements is NOT a myth about chocolate?

options.text: It is unsafe to feed chocolate to a dog

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is unsafe to feed chocolate to a dog

questions.question: What was the name that Aztecs and Mayas gave to the drink they produced from cocoa beans?
This delicacy, typical for ‘The Country of the Rising Sun’, usually only consists of thinly sliced raw seafood, dipping sauce and garnish.
Who developed the process of conching, which is used for a better refining of chocolate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudolph Lindt

questions.question: What is the quantity of caffeine in an average chocolate?

options.text: as much as in a cup of tea
as much as in a cup of decaffeinated coffee
as much as in a cup of coffee
as much as in a glass of coke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: as much as in a cup of decaffeinated coffee

questions.question: This German dish, whose name means sow’s stomach is popular in Palatinate, a region in south-western Germany.
This member of Czech cuisine, consists of a marinated sausage, usually served with slices of Czech bread.
Which type of chocolate is richest in fat?
What does the term dutching mean when referring to chocolate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alkalizing the chocolate

questions.question: How does chocolate affect blood cholesterol levels?

options.text: It raises both LDL (bad cholesterol) and HDL(good cholesterol)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It raises only HDL (good cholesterol)

questions.question: Which of these is a French dish, whose main ingredients are veal, onions and mushrooms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blanquette de veau

questions.question: Why does chocolate melt in your mouth?

options.text: The melting point of cocoa butter is a little lower than the human body temperature
The melting point of cocoa butter is a little higher than the human body temperature
It contains nutrients that speed up salivation

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The melting point of cocoa butter is a little lower than the human body temperature

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Wine and Bvd
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, gossard, bvd. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This agent, present in the skin of grapes, is one of the most important beneficiary agents in wine.  It has antioxidant, anticoagulant, anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties.
Which word refers to leotard-like undergarment that has snaps at the crotch?
This undergarment was originally introduced in 1968 by Gossard, with the byline “makes 34 look 36, makes 36 look pow…”.
This buttonless and collarless piece of clothing was originally worn as an undershirt.
What is the common American nickname for briefs, a type of Y-shaped underwear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tighty whities

questions.question: Another research used mice to reveal that red wine can slow down the development of cancer cells and increase life expectancy of rodents. Researchers attribute this to the anti-oxidizing properties of these agents.
The Framingham Heart Study concluded that moderate drinkers were 50 % less likely to die from coronary diseases than this group of people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Non drinkers

questions.question: This skirt-like undergarment was worn for warmth or to give a skirt or dress the desired fashionable shape.
This is a one-piece garment, that men in some hot countries wear around their waist.
If you drink more red wine than the recommended dose, you will increase the benefits.
This is the recommended beneficial daily dose of wine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One to two glasses

questions.question: BVD is a brand of mens underwear, commonly referred to as BVDs. What does BVD stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bradley, Voorhees and Day

questions.question: High consumption of saturated fats increases the risk of cardiovascular diseases. Although the residents of the Toulouse region in France consume dishes with plenty of saturated fat, the occurrence of cardiovascular diseases there is comparatively low.  It is because they drink a lot of wine, which helps accelerate the elimination of this from the blood.
For its ability to reduce anxiety and tension, wine is considered to be this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natural tranquilizer

questions.question: This garment, which replaced the corset, is constructed of elasticized fabric and usually fastened by hook and eye closures.
